title: How to Make Chocolate Milk from Cocoa

steps.title: Take a spoon that is about equal to a tablespoon.
steps.content: Take a spoon that is about equal to a tablespoon. An actual measuring spoon is good, but a regular spoon will work as well. Spoon two tablespoons each of sugar and cocoa powder into a saucepan. Start out with equal amounts of each and you can adjust.

steps.title: Add just enough milk to create a thick, lumpy paste at the bottom of your saucepan.
steps.content: Add just enough milk to create a thick, lumpy paste at the bottom of your saucepan.

steps.title: Place your saucepan on top, stirring constantly.
steps.content: Place your saucepan on top, stirring constantly.

steps.title: Transfer your mixture to a glass of your choice once it has no more lumps.
steps.content: Transfer your mixture to a glass of your choice once it has no more lumps. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Add the rest of your milk, stirring constantly.
steps.content: Add the rest of your milk, stirring constantly. [2] X Research source

steps.title: If you are going to use a microwave.
steps.content: If you are going to use a microwave. [3] X Research source 1. Repeat step one (using a microwave safe mug instead of a saucepan) 2. Place your mug into a microwave and microwave for 20 seconds on high power. [4] X Research source 3. Take your mug out and stir your mixture. 4. Microwave one or two more times (stirring in between) or until there are no more lumps. 5. Finish off by stirring in the rest of your milk.
